page.title: 01SOUTH WEST CAMBRIDGESHIRE
page.content: This very sparsely populated area of light soils is devoted almost entirely to large scale cereal production. From west to east the ancient Ickmeld Way is now a farm road but a well used walk for people from far and wide. Other reminders of antiquity are the strip lynchets on Anthony Hill and the Steydon or Brand Ditch of very ancient origin. The B1368 which traverses the western edge from south to north used to be the main coach route from London to Cambridge, Commemorated in the Name of a Public House. and still retaining one of a whole series of early milestones recording the distances from London to Cambridge. Ten years ago, Heydon, a large part of which lies within the allotted area, had four farms each tenanted by a resident farmer and employing collectively some twenty to thirty local men.
